relation: The absolute best deal I've ever seen on college classes. It's affordable, and close to town. How can you ask for more?

Hang out on the tree deck! There's always a great group of people when it's nice out! Also, get involved! The drama program is pretty cool, and there are so many clubs to be a part of, it's easy to feel like you're a part of something.
The salad bar is amazing, plus the healthy snacks are a nice change from normal cafeteria food.
Stay organized. With shorter classes, it's often easy to lose track of what's due, but if you can stay on top of your assignments, everything else is a piece of cake.

Small classrooms give excellent opportunities to be able to talk to your professor, and not feel too intimidated to ask questions. A lovely clean campus with plenty of welcoming benches and decks to enjoy the outdoors gives you a refreshing break between classes. Faculty is incredible, they're willing to help each student rise to the occasion and give their best.
pageTitle: Asheville-Buncombe Technical Community College Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex

textAfterTable: Diana from Fairview, NC 07/13/2011 Reviewer is A current student here. 3 out of 3 people found this review useful. 2 of 33 Categories Comments Great for these types of students Anyone who wants to save money and stay in Asheville in order to get some education for a new job or to take general education courses before transferring to a university. Tips for prospective students This is a very respectable two-year school and offers many programs where you can go straight into a job without transferring to a four-year school. If you wish to transfer to a four-year school there are three programs you can complete and many classes offered that will transfer. Bang for the buck Very affordable although the tuition did go up $10 since the cut backs from the government. Am enjoying being here It's a really student-friendly campus and provides many services to help you succeed. Am learning a lot
